controls.title: Ensure address space layout randomization is enabled
controls.description: Address space layout randomization (ASLR) is an exploit mitigation technique which randomly arranges the address space of key data areas of a process.
controls.rationale: Randomly placing virtual memory regions will make it difficult to write memory page exploits as the memory placement will be consistently shifting.
controls.impact: Some applications may not work with ASLR enabled. Check before enabling.

controls.title: Ensure ptrace_scope is restricted
controls.description: The ptrace() system call allows a parent process to observe and control the execution of another process.
controls.rationale: Restricting the use of ptrace to only child processes will help mitigate potential privilege escalation attacks.
controls.impact: Some debugging tools may not work properly with this setting.

controls.title: Ensure core dumps are restricted
controls.description: A core dump is the recorded state of the working memory of a computer program at a specific time.
controls.rationale: Core dumps may contain sensitive information and should be restricted.
controls.impact: Debugging may be more difficult without core dumps.

controls.title: Ensure prelink is not installed
controls.description: prelink is a program that modifies ELF shared libraries and ELF dynamically linked binaries in such a way that the time needed for the dynamic linker to perform relocations at startup significantly decreases.
controls.rationale: The prelinking feature can interfere with the operation of AIDE, because it changes binaries.

controls.title: Ensure Automatic Error Reporting is not enabled
controls.description: apport collects potentially sensitive data, such as core dumps, stack traces, and log files.
controls.rationale: This information could be used by an attacker to learn about the system and gain more knowledge on potential attack vectors.
controls.impact: Automatic error reporting will be disabled.
